content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (x=-17.0, y=-52.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill (position x=-17.0, y=-52.0)  
- Wooden chest (position x=-16.5, y=-50.5)  
- Burner inserter (position x=-17.5, y=-50.5)  

#### Smelting Setup at position (x=-15.0, y=-51.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone furnace (position x=-15.0, y=-51.0)  
- Burner inserter (position x=-14.5, y=-52.5)  
- Wooden chest (position x=-13.5, y=-51.5)  

#### Additional Smelting Setup at position (x=-13.0, y=-50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone furnace (position x=-13.0, y=-50.0)  
- Burner inserter (position x=-11.5, y=-50.5)  

---

### ERROR TIPS

#### Errors when attempting to retrieve a non-existent entity
- Ensure the entity exists at the specified position before attempting to retrieve it. For example, verify the presence of a wooden chest at (x=-14.5, y=-47.5) before calling `get_entity`.

#### Errors when inserting items into a furnace without the required resources
- Check your inventory for the necessary items (e.g., iron ore) before attempting to insert them into a furnace.

#### Errors when extracting items from a mining drill without resources
- Ensure the mining drill has extracted resources (e.g., iron ore) before attempting to extract them. Verify the drill's status and inventory.

#### Errors when mining drills are out of fuel
- Always ensure mining drills have sufficient fuel (e.g., coal) to operate. Refuel them when necessary.

#### Errors when chests at drop positions are full
- Empty chests at drop positions (e.g., x=-16.5, y=-50.5) to allow mining drills to continue operating.

#### Errors when inserters are waiting for source items or space in destination
- Ensure inserters have access to source items and that their destination (e.g., furnaces or chests) has space to receive items.
